cn.edu.uestc.acmicpc.db.condition.base

Class BaseCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • cn.edu.uestc.acmicpc.db.condition.base.BaseCondition
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArticleCondition, ContestCondition, ContestProblemCondition, ProblemCondition, StatusCondition, TrainingContestCondition, TrainingStatusCondition, TrainingUserCondition, UserCondition

    public abstract class BaseCondition
extends Object
    We can use this class to get Condition entity.

    USAGE

    We can write a simple class than extends this class, and add the BaseCondition.Exp annotation to each field of the class. If we do not do with, the field will be handled in subclass getCondition method.

    For developer:

    • In default, the map field's name is equal to the data field's name. If you want to map the class field into another data field, use the Exp#mapField() parameter please.

      For example:

      @Exp(mapField = "userId", type = ConditionType.EQUALS)
      public Integer id;

    • ConditionType.LIKE type will add % in two ends of the string, otherwise please handle this case in getCondition by yourself.

      For example:

      public String userName;
      @Override
      public Condition getCondition() {
        Condition condition = super.getCondition();
        if (userName != null) {
          conditions.addEntry("userName", ConditionType.STRING_EQUALS, "%" + userName);
        }
        return condition;
      }
